justification: “we collected the following psychometric surveys … the state-trait anxiety index (STAI-T)” – indicating trait anxiety was assessed with the STAI-T scale.
The same sentence lists “the Zung depression scale (SDS)” among the surveys, showing depression was measured with the SDS.
The survey battery included “the obsessive-compulsive inventory (OCI-R)”, identifying it as the instrument for OCD symptoms.

measured_by: Factor 1 score from factor analysis of STAI-T, SDS, OCI-R items
justification: “Factor analysis identified three… factors: positive affect (factor 1…) … We added the subject-level factor scores to the … model”, showing factor-1 scores operationalise positive affect.

measured_by: Factor 2 score from factor analysis of STAI-T, SDS, OCI-R items
justification: The factor analysis yielded “intrusive thoughts and rumination (factor 2; e.g. ‘I lack self-confidence’)”, with the corresponding factor-2 scores used in analyses.

measured_by: Factor 3 score from factor analysis of STAI-T, SDS, OCI-R items
justification: The same analysis produced “obsessive-compulsive behaviors (factor 3; e.g. ‘I feel I have to repeat certain numbers’)”, hence factor-3 scores index this construct.

measured_by: Normed d′ memorability rating of face images
justification: “image stimuli … from a database of face images with normed perceptual memorability ratings (PM)… each image was associated with a normed d′ score that measured how well these images are recognized”, indicating memorability was quantified with these d′ ratings.
“We utilized a Rescorla-Wagner model to fit behavior … trial-wise RPEs estimated by the model”, showing RPEs were operationalised via model-derived estimates.
